title: English Grammar Skills
description: Develop foundational grammar skills through topics like capitalisation and punctuation, similar-sounding words and opposites, and naming words (nouns) for Class 2 students.

subtopics.title: Capitalisation and Punctuation Marks
subtopics.content:
## Capitalisation and Punctuation Rules

Always begin a sentence with a capital letter. Example: Riya is my friend. Use full stop (.) at the end of a sentence. Use question mark (?) for asking something. Use exclamation mark (!) for surprise or strong feeling. Capitalise names of people, days, months, and places. Example: Monday, India, Amit.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Understanding Capitalisation and Punctuation:
- When do we begin sentences with capital letters?
- What punctuation marks end statements, questions, or show surprise?
- Name people, places, or days that need capital letters.

### Practice:
- Rewrite sentences with correct capitalisation and punctuation
- Identify errors in capitalisation or punctuation
- Add missing punctuation marks to sentences

subtopics.title: Similar-Sounding Words and Opposites
subtopics.content:
## Similar-Sounding Words and Opposites

Similar-sounding words sound the same but mean different things. Examples: sun/son, two/too/to, pair/pear. Opposite words mean the reverse. Examples: hot/cold, big/small, day/night, happy/sad.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Understanding Similar Words and Opposites:
- What are similar-sounding words?
- Give examples of homophones and opposites.
- Choose correct word for sentences.

### Practice:
- Match similar-sounding word pairs
- Fill blanks with correct homophones
- Identify opposites in sentences

subtopics.title: Naming Words (Nouns)
subtopics.content:
## Naming Words - Nouns

Naming words are names of people, places, animals, or things. Examples: Rita, dog, school, table. Proper nouns are special names that begin with a capital letter. Example: Hyderabad. Common nouns are general names. Example: city, boy, flower.
subtopics.codeExample:
### Noun Identification:
- What are naming words?
- What is a proper noun? Give examples.
- What is a common noun? Give examples.

### Practice:
- Identify nouns in sentences
- Classify nouns as proper or common
- Write examples of each type
